newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: GCC chief tries to persuade Bahrain to attend summit.
newsitem.headline: GCC chief tries to persuade Bahrain to attend summit.

text.p: The head of the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) arrived in Bahrain on Monday in an apparent attempt to convince the island state's ruler to attend the next Gulf Arab summit.

The official Gulf News Agency said GCC Secretary-General Jameel Hujilan met Bahrain's Emir Sheikh Isa bin Sulman al-Khalifa immediately after his arrival. Crown Prince Sheikh Hamad bin Isa al-Khalifa also attended the meeting.
The agency gave no details, but sources at the Riyadh-based GCC said Hujilan's visit was aimed at trying to convince Bahrain to attend a Gulf Arab summit in the Qatari capital Doha in December.
They said the visit was at the request of Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates.

Bahrain and Qatar are locked in a territorial dispute over a cluster of barren reefs and islands which are potentially rich in oil and gas. They include Hawar islands, which have been controlled by Bahrain since the 1930s.
Bahrain has threatened to boycott the summit in protest against Qatar's failure to withdraw a case it has taken to the International Court of Justice to settle the dispute.
Qatar said it would only withdraw the case from the world court in the Hague if Saudi Arabia's mediation succeeded in settling the long-standing border row.
Qatar asked the court in 1991 to settle the problem. The court decided in January it had jurisdiction and is expected to produce a verdict by the end of this year.
